results.purpose: Track sprint progress, capacity planning, and team velocity for an engineering team working on product features and technical improvements
key_data_points: Team capacity ranges from 31-50 engineer days per sprint
Commitment typically ranges from 36-85 story points
Work allocation: 8 SPs for regular KTLO, 25% for tech tickets, 50% for main priorities, 25% for QWs
Velocity (Done/Capacity) ranges from 1.057 to 2.000, with recent average around 1.80
Average velocity over last 3 sprints: 1.58-2.00 in recent Q4 sprints

entities.name: Andrea
entities.context: Team member appearing in all sprints with varying availability (0-8 days)

entities.name: Ahmed
entities.context: Engineering Manager (EM) at 50% capacity, 0 available days

entities.name: Guhan
entities.context: Team member with 5-8 days availability per sprint

entities.name: Oliver
entities.context: Senior Engineer (SE) with reduced availability (days-1), typically 0-8 days

entities.name: Mateusz
entities.context: Team member with 0-8 days availability

entities.name: Suzi
entities.context: Team member with 5-8 days availability

entities.name: Desi
entities.context: Team member with 2-8 days availability

entities.name: Claudia
entities.context: Team member appearing in recent Q4 sprints with 2-8 days

entities.name: Shujath
entities.context: Team member appearing in Q1 sprints with 3-8 days

entities.name: Project Heaven
entities.context: Sprint goal for 2025-W45-46

entities.name: Pricing APIs
entities.context: Recurring goal across multiple sprints to implement correct pricing on user touchpoints

entities.name: iAdvize chatbot
entities.context: Launched in 2025-W37-38

entities.name: Wunderkind
entities.context: Email integration work in 2025-W35-36

entities.name: UPM (Universal Payment Method)
entities.context: Payment method feature worked on in Q1 sprints

insights: Team velocity has improved over time, from ~1.1-1.5 in Q1 to 1.8-2.0 in recent Q4 sprints
Pricing API implementation is a long-running initiative spanning multiple sprints from Q4 2025-W43 through W49-52
Sprint goals completion rate varies - many sprints have mix of TRUE (completed) and FALSE (incomplete) goals
Team size appears to be 7-8 engineers with varying availability due to part-time roles and other commitments
Capacity planning accounts for 25% tech debt/refactoring and 8 SPs for regular KTLO (Keep The Lights On) work
Recent sprints show higher commitment (65-85 SPs) compared to Q1 sprints (36-64 SPs), suggesting team maturity or growth
Some team members have reduced availability (Oliver as SE with days-1, Ahmed at 50% as EM)
Work focuses on pricing systems, user experience features, experiments, and technical migrations

results.purpose: Feature discovery and scoping document for TPT (The Pet Table) mobile app development, tracking which features will be implemented in-app vs web view
key_data_points: Priority features: Dashboard and delivery management functions

entities.name: TPT (The Pet Table)
entities.context: Pet food subscription service developing mobile app

entities.name: MC
entities.context: Reviewer providing comments and suggestions on technical implementation choices

entities.name: React Native
entities.context: Primary technology platform for native app features

entities.name: Web View
entities.context: Alternative implementation method for certain features

insights: Dashboard and delivery management features are prioritized for React Native implementation to ensure faster app performance
Static pages are mostly excluded from the app scope, with recommendation to use web views if needed
The entire Quiz flow (10 steps) is currently out of scope for the app
Checkout process is completely out of scope for initial app version
Add-On Market features are fully in scope and prioritized for React Native
There's ongoing discussion about whether to use React Native vs Web View for certain features, with MC questioning some React Native choices
Account Management features are mostly in scope but implemented via Web View rather than React Native
Reactivations and multipet functionality are in scope with React Native implementation

results.purpose: Internal marketing performance tracker for Good Chop, monitoring weekly metrics and campaigns
key_data_points: Spans approximately 3+ years of marketing data (2021-2024)

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Company being tracked - likely a food/meal delivery service based on name

entities.name: Self-Improvement
entities.context: Marketing campaign with documented spend of $1,053 and 1 conversion/unit

insights: Long-term tracking system covering 3+ years of weekly marketing data
WoW (Week-over-Week) analysis implemented starting in late 2022, suggesting increased focus on performance monitoring
Sparse data visible in extract suggests either incomplete data entry or filtered view
Self-Improvement campaign shows spend without corresponding revenue, indicating either a loss-making campaign or incomplete data
Consistent weekly cadence (W format) indicates disciplined tracking methodology
Structure suggests tracking of multiple campaigns/channels with metrics like spend, revenue, and conversions

results.purpose: Track sprint progress, capacity planning, and velocity metrics for an engineering team working on product features and technical improvements
key_data_points: Team capacity ranges from 31-50 engineer days per sprint
Commitment follows 50% main priority, 25% tech tickets, 25% QWs, plus 8 SPs for KTLO
Velocity (Done/Capacity) ranges from 1.06 to 2.00, with recent average around 1.80
Most recent sprint (2025-W49-52): 36 engineer days capacity, 72 SPs committed, 72 done
Team size: 7-8 engineers including EM and SE roles

entities.context: Core team member, consistently available across all sprints

insights: Team velocity improved significantly in Q4 2025, reaching 2.0 in recent sprints vs 1.1-1.5 in Q1

Work allocation follows consistent pattern: 50% main priorities, 25% quality work, 25% tech debt/refactoring, plus 8 SPs KTLO
Team composition changed between Q1 and Q4 (Shujath out, Claudia in)
Most sprint goals are achieved (marked TRUE), indicating effective planning
Capacity fluctuates based on individual availability, ranging from 0-8 days per person per sprint
Recent sprints show over-delivery (velocity >1.8), suggesting either improved efficiency or underestimation
Product focus areas include: pricing systems, meal customization (calories, portions, allergies), checkout improvements, and user experience experiments

results.doc_title: [VIEW ONLY] F_ Meal & Add On Database
results.purpose: Meal planning and recipe database for a meal delivery service, tracking nutritional information, costs, ratings, dietary attributes, and operational details

entities.name: AS
entities.context: Chef's initials for Red Pepper Bruschetta Shredded Chicken

entities.name: SH
entities.context: Chef's initials for Garlic Tomato Cream Shredded Beef and Ají Verde Turkey

entities.name: MJ
entities.context: Chef's initials for Ginger Sesame Chicken & Scallion Rice

entities.name: Chicken & Mushroom Marsala
entities.context: Multiple recipe variations (F00002A-F) in Graveyard status

entities.name: Red Pepper Bruschetta Shredded Chicken
entities.context: New status meal with approval date 10/21/2025

entities.name: Garlic Tomato Cream Shredded Beef
entities.context: New status meal with approval date 10/21/2025

entities.name: Ají Verde Turkey
entities.context: New status meal with approval date 10/28/2025

entities.name: Ginger Sesame Chicken & Scallion Rice
entities.context: New status meal with approval date 11/11/2025

insights: Multiple recipe variations exist for the same meal (Chicken & Mushroom Marsala has 6+ versions with slight cost and nutritional differences)
Meals are categorized by status: 'Graveyard' (discontinued) and 'New' (upcoming launches)
Strong focus on dietary attributes: tracks 16+ dietary flags including Keto, Calorie Smart, High Protein, Dairy Free, GLP-1 Balance, Mediterranean
Chicken-based meals dominate the sample, with various protein types (breast, shredded, diced)
European/Italian cuisine is most common in this sample
All meals use standardized cooking methods (Grill, Oven, Braiser) and container types (1-3 CT)
New meals have future approval dates (Oct-Nov 2025), suggesting forward planning pipeline
Sleeve colors (Yellow, Red) appear to indicate meal categorization or handling requirements
Cost efficiency varies: actual costs ($1.94-$3.65) are tracked against max meal costs ($2.54-$3.49)
Nutrition scoring system in place (0-4.125 scale) with fiber content tracked separately

results.purpose: Track and schedule demo presentations for various product features and projects across different teams/squads, including presenter information, production status, and relevant documentation links
key_data_points: Preliminary ordering system (1-6) for presentation sequence

entities.name: Growth Alliance
entities.context: Parent organization for multiple squads including Conversion Comms, Customer Value Forecasting, CRM Engine, and Active Journey Alliance

entities.name: SCM Inventory Management
entities.context: Team responsible for warehouse management, procurement integration, and inventory staging projects

entities.name: Harneet Singh, Alvaro Magalhaes, Aleksandr Shalaev
entities.context: Presenters for Ad progression customized funnels demo

entities.name: Adrian Southwart, Jasper van Leeuwen
entities.context: Presenters for WMS 2.0 warehouse replenishment demo in Netherlands facility

entities.name: Statsig
entities.context: Platform used for A/B testing integration and CLV model deployment

entities.name: Workday Procurement
entities.context: Integrated with Oracle Finance for indirect procurement across HelloFresh

entities.name: Iterable
entities.context: Platform for embedded message campaigns with dynamic audience selection

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Parent company operating warehouses, procurement, and customer-facing products

entities.name: BOLT/NDD
entities.context: Fast delivery services that increased delivery option complexity

entities.name: Project DISH
entities.context: Debox Ingredient Staging Harmonization for WMS work order picking

insights: Most projects (7 out of 9) are already in production, indicating this is primarily a showcase of completed work rather than future planning
Strong focus on optimization and automation: AI-powered accessibility scanning, automated recipe grading, CLV prediction models, and personalized marketing funnels
Cross-functional collaboration evident with multiple squads/alliances working together (e.g., Conversion Comms Squad + Growth Alliance)
Supply chain and logistics are major focus areas with 4 demos related to warehouse management, inventory, and delivery optimization
Netherlands facility mentioned as 'best performing warehouse in the world'
Scheduling conflicts noted: one demo was on agenda previous week but not completed, presenters can be swapped for topic variety
Integration between major enterprise systems (Workday, Oracle, Statsig, Iterable) is a key theme
UK region delivery options increased dramatically from 63 to 198 due to fast delivery services, requiring UI redesign
AI/ML applications span multiple domains: accessibility compliance, recipe quality assessment, and customer lifetime value prediction

results.purpose: Tracks marketing vouchers and promotional codes for free product offers to customers
key_data_points: 15 different product voucher types (bacon, wings, beef, salmon, steaks, cheesecake)
Two duration types: 'For Life' and 'For Year' promotions
Multiple promo code campaigns: TURKEY, TRK, TRKXA series, GBL
ODL (Order Data List) integration for customer IDs

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Main company offering meat and food subscription service with promotional vouchers

entities.name: Turkey Campaign Codes
entities.context: Multiple turkey-related promotional codes (ORGANIC TURKEY, TURKEY ACTIVATION NAE, TURKEY REACTIVATION NAE, TURKEY CODE 2023)

entities.name: TRKXA Series
entities.context: Systematic promo code series (TRKXA1A, TRKXA1B, TRKXA2A, etc.) with SKU index 60

entities.name: GBL Campaign
entities.context: Promotional campaign with SKU index 145 across multiple products

insights: Premium products (ribeyes, filet mignon, NY strip) offered as both lifetime and yearly promotions
Turkey-themed campaigns appear to be a major promotional focus with multiple code variations
Most vouchers have 'Actives email banner' set to TRUE for customer communication
Products are primarily ABF (Antibiotic-Free) and include grass-fed options
Customer ID list contains 100+ entries, suggesting significant promotional reach
Systematic code structure (TRKXA + number + letter) indicates organized campaign management
Mix of proteins (beef, chicken, turkey, salmon) and premium cuts shows diverse product portfolio
SKU index 145 appears frequently across TRK, GBL, and TURKEY campaigns, suggesting coordinated multi-channel promotion

results.doc_title: [VIEW ONLY] F_ Meal & Add On Database
results.purpose: Meal planning and recipe database for a meal delivery service, tracking nutritional information, costs, ratings, dietary attributes, and operational details
key_data_points: Calories ranging from 340 to 660 per meal

entities.name: AS (Chef)
entities.context: Chef's initials for Red Pepper Bruschetta Shredded Chicken

entities.name: SH (Chef)
entities.context: Chef's initials for Garlic Tomato Cream Shredded Beef and Ají Verde Turkey

entities.name: MJ (Chef)
entities.context: Chef's initials for Ginger Sesame Chicken

insights: Multiple recipe variations (A-F) exist for Chicken & Mushroom Marsala with slight cost and nutritional differences
All Chicken & Mushroom Marsala variants are marked as 'Graveyard' status (discontinued/inactive)
Newer recipes (F01907A, F01908A, F01912A, F01932A) are marked as 'New' or 'Pending' status
Strong focus on dietary accommodations: Calorie Smart, High Protein, Dairy Free, Pork Free, Low Carb, GLP-1 Balance
Chicken breast is the most common protein type in the sample
European/Italian cuisine is predominant, with some Asian and North American options
All meals use color-coded sleeves (Yellow or Red) for organization
Mediterranean and GLP-1 Support are tracked as emerging dietary categories
Preparation methods consistently include marinading, grilling, and oven cooking
